alert.note: Alert for Sierra Madre Range; Snowy Range (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 26 at 12:57AM MST until February 28 at 5:00PM MST by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 9 AM THIS MORNING TO 5 PM MST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 15 to 30 inches for the Sierra Madre Range. Higher amounts possible above 9000 feet. Total snow accumulations of 12 to 20 inches for the Snowy Range. Winds gusting as high as 60 mph. * WHERE...Sierra Madre Range and Snowy Range. * WHEN...From 9 AM Sunday to 5 PM MST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. Hikers and snowmobilers may easily become disoriented and lost due to the very poor visibility.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
